ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Given that this class was cross-listed as an HPA course, I was a little disappointed that it was so centered at the undergraduate population. There was little mention of public health practice. However, it was informative and interesting.
The strengths are the significance and attractiveness of the topics. The weakness is lack of class discussion, although it was aimed.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Jody Sindelar  While Professor Sindelar is immensely brilliant, it appears that she has a lot on her plate. While she provided a wealth of knowledge, it was sometimes in a confusing manner.
Instructor: Jody Sindelar  She is great but could have reduced her talk a bit more and interact with the class a little bit more.
Instructor: Jody Sindelar  Professor Sindelar was great!

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Michael Richards is good, very organized, and made good comments in class that contributed to class discussion.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is an undergraduate course on the economics of addiction. With certain modifications and a refocus on the public health education, I would recommend it.
